metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Learn how to create a responsive website that will work on all devices, PC, laptop, tablet, and phone.
content.html: Learn how to create a responsive website that will work on all devices, PC, laptop, tablet, and phone.

content.text: It can be wise to draw a layout draft of the page design before creating a website:
content.html: It can be wise to draw a layout draft of the page design before creating a website:
Some text some text..
Some text some text..
Some text some text..
Some text some text..

content.text: HTML is the standard markup language for creating websites and CSS is the language that describes the style of an HTML document. We will combine HTML and CSS to create a basic web page.
content.html: HTML is the standard markup language for creating websites and CSS is the language that describes the style of an HTML document. We will combine HTML and CSS to create a basic web page.

links.text:
we suggest that you 
  start by reading our HTML Tutorial

content.text: Note: If you don't know HTML and CSS, we suggest that you start by reading our HTML Tutorial .
content.html: Note: If you don't know HTML and CSS, we suggest that you start by reading our HTML Tutorial.

content.code:
My Website

A website created by me.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<title>Page Title</title>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
<style>
body {
  font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<h1>My Website</h1>
<p>A website created by me.</p>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Inside the <body> element of our website, we will use our "Layout Draft" and create:
content.html: Inside the <body> element of our website, we will use our "Layout Draft" and create:

content.text: A header is usually located at the top of the website (or right below a top navigation menu). It often contains a logo or the website name:
content.html: A header is usually located at the top of the website (or right below a top navigation menu). It often contains a logo or the website name:

content.code:
My Website

 

A website created by me.
content.code_html:
<div class="header">
  <h1>My Website</h1>
  <p>A website created by me.</p>
</div>

content.text: Then we use CSS to style the header:
content.html: Then we use CSS to style the header:

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* Increase the font size of the <h1> element */

syntax_highlighting.text: /* Increase the font size of the <h1> element */

content.code_html:
.header {
  padding: 80px; /* some padding */
  text-align: center; /* center the text */
  background: #1abc9c; /* green background */
  color: white; /* white text color */
}

/* Increase the font size of the <h1> element */
.header h1 {
  font-size: 40px;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* Increase the font size of the <h1> element */

content.text: A navigation bar contains a list of links to help visitors navigating through your website:
content.html: A navigation bar contains a list of links to help visitors navigating through your website:

content.code: Link   Link   Link   Link
content.code_html:
<div class="navbar">
  <a href="#">Link</a>
  <a href="#">Link</a>
  <a href="#">Link</a>
  <a href="#" class="right">Link</a>
</div>

content.text: Use CSS to style the navigation bar:
content.html: Use CSS to style the navigation bar:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
overflow: hidden; /* Hide overflow */  background-color: #333; 
  /* Dark background color */

/* Make sure that the links stay 
  side-by-side */

/* Change the display to 
  block, for responsive reasons (see below) */

float: right; 
  /* Float a link to the right */
/* Float a link to the right */

background-color: #ddd; /* Grey background color */  color: black; 
  /* Black text color */

syntax_highlighting.text:
overflow: hidden; /* Hide overflow */  background-color: #333;
/* Dark background color */

/* Make sure that the links stay 
  side-by-side */

/* Change the display to 
  block, for responsive reasons (see below) */

float: right;
/* Float a link to the right */
/* Float a link to the right */

background-color: #ddd; /* Grey background color */  color: black;
/* Black text color */

content.code_html:
/* Style the top navigation bar */
.navbar {
  overflow: hidden; /* Hide overflow */
  background-color: #333; /* Dark background color */
}

/* Style the navigation bar links */
.navbar a {
  float: left; /* Make sure that the links stay side-by-side */
  display: block; /* Change the display to block, for responsive reasons (see below) */
  color: white; /* White text color */
  text-align: center; /* Center the text */
  padding: 14px 20px; /* Add some padding */
  text-decoration: none; /* Remove underline */
}

/* Right-aligned link */
.navbar a.right {
  float: right; /* Float a link to the right */
}

/* Change color on hover/mouse-over */
.navbar a:hover {
  background-color: #ddd; /* Grey background color */
  color: black; /* Black text color */
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
overflow: hidden; /* Hide overflow */  background-color: #333; 
  /* Dark background color */

/* Make sure that the links stay 
  side-by-side */

/* Change the display to 
  block, for responsive reasons (see below) */

float: right; 
  /* Float a link to the right */
/* Float a link to the right */

background-color: #ddd; /* Grey background color */  color: black; 
  /* Black text color */

content.text: Create a 2-column layout, divided into a "side content" and a "main content".
content.html: Create a 2-column layout, divided into a "side content" and a "main content".

content.code_html:
<div class="row">
  <div class="side">...</div>
  <div class="main">...</div>
</div>

content.text: We use CSS Flexbox to handle the layout:
content.html: We use CSS Flexbox to handle the layout:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
/* Create 
  two unequal columns that sits next to each other */

flex: 30%; /* Set the width of the sidebar 
  */  background-color: #f1f1f1; /* Grey background color 
  */  padding: 20px; /* Some padding */

/* Set the width of the sidebar 
  */
flex: 70%; /* Set the width of the main content */  background-color: white; /* White background color */  padding: 20px; /* Some padding */
/* Set the width of the main content */

syntax_highlighting.text:
/* Create 
  two unequal columns that sits next to each other */

flex: 30%; /* Set the width of the sidebar 
  */  background-color: #f1f1f1; /* Grey background color 
  */  padding: 20px; /* Some padding */

/* Set the width of the sidebar 
  */
flex: 70%; /* Set the width of the main content */  background-color: white; /* White background color */  padding: 20px; /* Some padding */
/* Set the width of the main content */

content.code_html:
/* Ensure proper sizing */
* {
  box-sizing: border-box;
}

/* Column container */
.row {
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
}

/* Create two unequal columns that sits next to each other */
/* Sidebar/left column */
.side {
  flex: 30%; /* Set the width of the sidebar */
  background-color: #f1f1f1; /* Grey background color */
  padding: 20px; /* Some padding */
}

/* Main column */
.main {
  flex: 70%; /* Set the width of the main content */
  background-color: white; /* White background color */
  padding: 20px; /* Some padding */
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
/* Create 
  two unequal columns that sits next to each other */

flex: 30%; /* Set the width of the sidebar 
  */  background-color: #f1f1f1; /* Grey background color 
  */  padding: 20px; /* Some padding */

/* Set the width of the sidebar 
  */
flex: 70%; /* Set the width of the main content */  background-color: white; /* White background color */  padding: 20px; /* Some padding */
/* Set the width of the main content */

content.text: Then add media queries to make the layout responsive. This will make sure that your website looks good on all devices (desktops, laptops, tablets and phones). Resize the browser window to see the result.
content.html: Then add media queries to make the layout responsive. This will make sure that your website looks good on all devices (desktops, laptops, tablets and phones). Resize the browser window to see the result.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
/* Responsive layout - when the screen is less than 700px wide, make the two 
  columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */

syntax_highlighting.text:
/* Responsive layout - when the screen is less than 700px wide, make the two 
  columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */

content.code_html:
/* Responsive layout - when the screen is less than 700px wide, make the two columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */
@media screen and (max-width: 700px) {
  .row {
    flex-direction: column;
  }
}

/* Responsive layout - when the screen is less than 400px wide, make the navigation links stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */
@media screen and (max-width: 400px) {
  .navbar a {
    float: none;
    width: 100%;
  }
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
/* Responsive layout - when the screen is less than 700px wide, make the two 
  columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */

content.text: Tip: To create a different kind of layout, just change the flex width (but make sure that it adds up to 100%).
content.html: Tip: To create a different kind of layout, just change the flex width (but make sure that it adds up to 100%).

links.text:
Read more about 
it in our CSS Media Queries chapter

content.text: Tip: Do you wonder how the @media rule works? Read more about it in our CSS Media Queries chapter .
content.html: Tip: Do you wonder how the @media rule works? Read more about it in our CSS Media Queries chapter.

content.text: Tip: To learn more about the Flexible Box Layout Module, read our CSS Flexbox chapter .
content.html: Tip: To learn more about the Flexible Box Layout Module, read our CSS Flexbox chapter.
What is box-sizing?

content.text: You can easily create three floating boxes side by side. However, when you add something that enlarges the width of each box (e.g. padding or borders), the box will break. The box-sizing property allows us to include the padding and border in the box's total width (and height), making sure that the padding stays inside of the box and that it does not break.
content.html: You can easily create three floating boxes side by side. However, when you add something that enlarges the width of each box (e.g. padding or borders), the box will break. The box-sizing property allows us to include the padding and border in the box's total width (and height), making sure that the padding stays inside of the box and that it does not break.

content.text: You can read more about the box-sizing property in our CSS Box Sizing Tutorial .
content.html: You can read more about the box-sizing property in our CSS Box Sizing Tutorial.

content.text: At last, we will add a footer.
content.html: At last, we will add a footer.

content.code_html:
<div class="footer">
  <h2>Footer</h2>
</div>

content.html: And style it:

content.code_html:
.footer {
  padding: 20px; /* Some padding */
  text-align: center; /* Center text*/
  background: #ddd; /* Grey background */
}

content.text: Congratulations! You have built a responsive website from scratch.
content.html: Congratulations! You have built a responsive website from scratch.

content.html: If you want to create your own website and host your .html files, try our website builder, called W3schools Spaces:
